sections.title: Supported RNode Boards
sections.content:

sections.title: HF Radio Setup (Verified)
sections.content:
LFM tested configuration for Reticulum over HF radio using FreeDV DATAC1 mode.

Hardware

ComponentModel
ComputerRaspberry Pi 4 (4GB+ RAM)
HF RadioXiegu G90
Audio InterfaceDigirig Mobile

Software Stack

# Install requirements
pipx install rns
pipx install nomadnet
pipx install freedvtnc2
sudo apt install libhamlib-utils

Start rigctld (radio control)

rigctld -m 3088 -r /dev/ttyUSB0 -s 19200 \
  --set-conf=serial_handshake=None,rts_state=OFF,dtr_state=OFF &

Start freedvtnc2 (modem)

freedvtnc2 --input-device 1 --output-device 1 \
  --mode DATAC1 --rigctld-port 4532 \
  --ptt-on-delay-ms 300 --ptt-off-delay-ms 200 \
  --output-volume -3

Audio Levels (Digirig on card 3)

amixer -c 3 sset 'Speaker' 64%
amixer -c 3 sset 'Mic',0 cap 75%
amixer -c 3 sset 'Mic' unmute

Performance

ParameterValue
Data rate~980 bps
Bandwidth1.7 kHz
Latency3-5 seconds
Range50-5000+ km (propagation dependent)
Tested: This exact configuration is verified working. See github.com/LFManifesto/LFM-HF-Reticulum for full documentation.

sections.title: Flashing RNode Firmware
sections.content:
# Install rnodeconf (use pipx or venv)
pipx install rns

# Auto-install (interactive)
rnodeconf --autoinstall

Manual

# Check device info
rnodeconf /dev/ttyUSB0 --info

# Flash
rnodeconf /dev/ttyUSB0 --flash

If Flashing Fails

  • Hold BOOT button while connecting USB
  • Use data-capable cable (not charge-only)
  • Linux: sudo usermod -aG dialout $USER

sections.title: Serial Port Tips
sections.content:
Find Device

ls /dev/ttyUSB* /dev/ttyACM*

Use Persistent Names

ls /dev/serial/by-id/

Use the by-id path in config to avoid port reassignment on reboot.

Permissions (Linux)

sudo usermod -aG dialout $USER
# Log out and back in
